thread.title: Aust dollar heads towards US70c
thread.title_full: Aust dollar heads towards US70c | Business Spectator

author: AAP
title: Aust dollar heads towards US70c
text:
The Australian dollar is pushing its way back up towards US70c, thanks to the release of some strong jobs figures.
At 12.00pm (AEST) on Thursday, the currency was trading at US69.91c, down from US70.49c on Wednesday.
Earlier in the morning the currency fell as low as US69.46c, after the Reserve Bank of New Zealand cut its interest rate, citing weaker economic growth.
But the currency bounced after the latest employment figures showed that unemployment fell to 6.2 per cent in August and that there was another strong month of jobs growth, with the total number of people with jobs up 17,400.
NAB senior economist David de Garis said the figures were solid and in line with "a pretty consistent picture of employment growth over the past few months".
"(Monthly) employment growth of two per cent is more than respectable when the resources sector and allied industries have been laying off people," he said.
